title: Dirichlet function
summary: In mathematics, the Dirichlet function[1][2] is the indicator function 1Q or 1 Q {\displaystyle \mathbf {1} _{\mathbb {Q} }} of the set of rational numbers Q, i.e. 1Q(x) = 1 if x is a rational number and 1Q(x) = 0 if x is not a rational number (i.e. an irrational number).
